text:
So AWS re/Start, it's a partnership program
that we actually have with

BMO and a recruitment firm
that specializes in diverse recruitment activities.

Between the combined efforts
between the three parties,

we provide a curated program
which trains a diverse candidate with cloud skill sets,

that can lead to a full-time employment
opportunity within our organization.
I wanted to live up to our commitments from a DNI perspective,

and we had to recruit talent
externally with the new skillsets we needed.
And it kind of dawned in a great conversation with AWS around
how do we solve for both problems?

They didn't really have to be mutually exclusive.
We could tackle them together.
And that's what came of the AWS re/Start program with us.
So a big part of it was solving for the diversity goals that we had in terms of recruiting from the indigenous communities.
So we partnered together with AWS re/Start to train the candidates with the right, I would say, attitude, cultural fit with the skillset.

And in terms of impacts to our
client and customers, everything's connected.
When you have the right skillset, right talents,

we can do execution a lot faster creating value, products,
solutions that impact the end clients and customers.
